Description: Fragment of a seal-impression. The fine brown Nile clay with some mica inclusions was hardened after excavation. The rear shows a bent surface with the shape which could originate from a vessel (or bag), covered in textile. In the break two impressions of a turned cord with a width of 0.2 cm. The front side is covered with parts of finger-impressions and bears a small part of an impression of an oval scarab-like seal. Visible is an elongated sign, maybe a crocodile or a lizard lying. The rest is broken off.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
